Uses of Class
derby.DBException

Packages that use DBException
derby   
 

Uses of DBException in derby
 

Methods in derby that throw DBException
private  void DBHandler.deleteDB()
          Deletes all tables in the database, effectively reseting the DB to its original state.
private  int DBHandler.getArticlesCount(java.lang.String constraint)
          Returns a count of the number of articles in the database which meet the condition of the constraint.
 boolean Database.modify(java.lang.String sqlstatement)
          Performs modifications on the database.
 java.sql.ResultSet Database.query(java.lang.String sqlstatement)
          Performs a query on an existing database and returns the ResultSet
private  void DBHandler.setupDB()
          Runs a setup algorithm which creates the feeds, articles, and user tables, as well as the 'Subscribed Feeds' and 'Outbox' folders, which must exist on creation according to the Rep Invariant.
 boolean Database.shutdown()
          Shuts down the database.
 boolean Database.startup()
          Starts up the database.
